translated: The fruit that a man obtains by bathing in all the holy places,

analyzed: tat phalam prāpnuyāt martyaḥ guru pāda kaṇā jalāt guru pāda udakāt kaṇāt  sa snātaḥ sarva tīrtheṣu yaḥ abhiṣekam samācaret

analyzed: tena eva rajasā devi tilakam yaḥ tu kārayet

analyzed: dvitīyaḥ paṭalaḥ

analyzed: śrī devī uvāca

analyzed: parama ānanda sandoha carācara jagadguro

analyzed: īśvaraḥ uvāca

analyzed: yām āsādya ca nirvāṇa muktim eti nara adhamaḥ

translated: If the japa is performed without proper resolve, or if there is deficiency or excess,

translated: The Lord said:

analyzed: dadāmi paramam brahma mumūrṣoḥ karṇa gocare

analyzed: tūla rāśim dahati agniḥ kiñcid kālāt yathā śive
translated: Just as fire burns a heap of cotton in a short time, O Śiva,

analyzed: tathā dahet karma rāśim kāśī janma ekataḥ nṛṇām
translated: In the same way, Kāśī burns the heap of karma of men just by their birth there.

analyzed: kāśīsthānam puṇya cayam kim vā aham kathayāmi te

translated: Even if there is a woman like you and a man like me,

analyzed: tadā kāśī phalam kiñcid devi vaktum kṣamaḥ bhavet  /
translated: then, O Goddess, one would be able to speak a little about the fruit of Kāśī.

analyzed: aṇḍa jāḥ ūṣma jāḥ ca eva udbhid jāḥ ca jarāyu jāḥ
translated: Whether born from eggs, heat, or the earth, or from a womb,

analyzed: te sarve muktim āyānti kāśyāt ced bhāgyataḥ mṛtāḥ
translated: all of them attain liberation if they die in Kāśī by chance.

analyzed: iyam vārāṇasī devi mahā tejaḥ mayī śubhā

analyzed: yuga bhedāt janaiḥ eva dṛśyate hi caturvidhā

analyzed: dvāpare sā śilā rūpā kalau bhūmi mayī śubhā

translated: There is no holy place superior to this in the three worlds.

analyzed: satyam satyam mahādevi śapathena vadāmi te
translated: It is the truth, the great truth, O great goddess, I swear to you.

analyzed: saṃsāra vartmanā devi muktim icchati yaḥ punar
translated: O goddess, he who desires liberation from the path of worldly existence,

analyzed: pāṣāṇeśvara lobhi tvāt tiṣṭhet kāśyām sa yantritaḥ
translated: should stay in Kāśī with restraint, attracted by Pāśāṇeśvara (the Lord of the Stone).

analyzed: saḥ eva paṇḍitaḥ jñānī saḥ eva kula pāvanaḥ
translated: He alone is wise, he alone is the purifier of the family.

analyzed: prāṇānte api mahādevi kāśīm na nistyajet budhaḥ
translated: O great goddess, even at the end of life, a wise man should not abandon Kāśī.

original: sa eva paramo mūrkhaḥ sa eva kulanāśakaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ eva paramaḥ mūrkhaḥ saḥ eva kula nāśakaḥ
translated: He alone is the greatest fool, he alone is the destroyer of the family,

analyzed: vṛthā eva mūrkha lokena kāśīm prāpya samujjhitam
translated: who, having reached Kāśī in vain, abandons it out of foolishness.

analyzed: bahubhiḥ janmabhiḥ puṇyaiḥ yadi kāśīm labhet janaḥ
translated: If a person obtains Kāśī after many births and merits,

analyzed: tadā nā eva tyajet kāśīm prāṇānte pi kadācana
translated: then he should never abandon Kāśī even at the end of life.

analyzed: anāyāsena saṃsāra sāgaram yaḥ titīrṣati
translated: He who desires to cross the ocean of worldly existence without effort,

analyzed: sa gacchet api yatnena mama vārāṇasīm purīm
translated: he should go even with effort to my city of Vārāṇasī.

analyzed: annam dadyāt anna pūrṇā jñānam dadyāt sarasvatī
translated: One should give food, Annapurna (Goddess of food) should give knowledge, Saraswati (Goddess of knowledge).

original: prāṇānte muktidātāḥaṃ kāśyāṃ sthitvā sadaiva hi // //
analyzed: prāṇānte mukti dātāḥ kāśyām sthitvā sadā eva hi
translated: The giver of liberation at the end of life is always present in Kashi.

original: evante kathitaṃ devi yat pṛṣṭaṃ girije mayi /

analyzed: madhyandine tathā āgneyyām vāyavyām prātar eva hi

analyzed: kusumam yāvakaḥ śaṅkhaḥ bherī vādyan ca bhūmipaḥ

analyzed: tantuvāyum samabhyarcya vāyu lokam avāpnuyāt

analyzed: pramātāmahaḥ eva ca
translated: And the great-grandfather,

analyzed: ye ca siṃha vyāghra sarpa prahṛtāḥ hṛtāḥ anyaiḥ ca prahṛtāḥ ca ye

analyzed: nihatāḥ ca ye
translated: And those who have been killed,

analyzed: daṃṣṭribhiḥ śṛṅgibhiḥ vā api teṣām piṇḍam dadāmi aham

analyzed: agni dagdhāḥ ca ye kecid na agni dagdhāḥ tathā pare

analyzed: vidyut caura hatāḥ ye ca teṣām piṇḍam dadāmi aham
translated: I offer this ball of rice to those who have been struck by lightning or thieves.

analyzed: paśu yoni gatāḥ ye ca pakṣi kīṭa sarīsṛpāḥ
translated: To those who have taken birth as animals, birds, insects, or reptiles,

analyzed: athavā vṛkṣa yoni sthāḥ teṣām piṇḍam dadāmi aham
translated: Or to those who are born as trees, I offer this ball of rice.

analyzed: asaṃkhya jana saṃsthāḥ ye ye nītāḥ yama śāsanam
translated: To those countless people who have been brought under the rule of Yama,

original: p / teṣāmuddharaṇārthāya imaṃ idaṃ yajurvedinā klībe prayujyate
analyzed: teṣām uddharaṇa arthāya imam idam yajurvedinā klībe prayujyate
translated: For their liberation, I offer this ball of rice according to the Yajur Veda.

analyzed: piṇḍam dadāmi aham
translated: I offer this ball of rice.

analyzed: jāti antara sahasrāṇi bhramanti svena karmaṇā
translated: Thousands of species of beings wander in their own actions,

original: manuṣyāntargatā rgataṃ yeṣāṃ yātanāśatamāhṛtam ye ca teṣāṃ
analyzed: manuṣya antargatāḥ rgatam yeṣām yātanā śatam āhṛtam ye ca teṣām
translated: Among humans, those who have undergone hundreds of tortures and those who have not,

analyzed: piṇḍam dadāmi aham
translated: I offer this ball of rice to them.

analyzed: anyeṣām yātanā sthānām preta loka nivāsinām
translated: To others who are in the abodes of torture, who dwell in the world of ghosts,

analyzed: teṣām uddharaṇa arthāya imam piṇḍam dadāmi aham
translated: For their liberation, I offer this ball of rice.

analyzed: ye bāndhava abāndhavāḥ vā yenya janmani bāndhavāḥ
translated: To those who are relatives or not relatives, who were relatives in other births,

analyzed: teṣām tu tṛptim āyāntu piṇḍa dānena sarvadā
translated: May they always be satisfied by the offering of this ball of rice.

original: ye ye pitṛkule jātāḥ kule mātustathaiva ca // //
analyzed: ye ye pitṛ kule jātāḥ kule mātuḥ tathā eva ca
translated: To those who are born in the family of the father and likewise in the family of the mother,

analyzed: guru śvaśura bandhūnām ye ca anye bāndhavāḥ mṛtāḥ
translated: To the Gurus, Fathers-in-law, relatives, and other deceased relatives,

original: ye ye kule luptapiṇḍāḥ putradāravivarjitāḥ // //🔽kriyālopagatā ye ca jātyandhāḥ paṅgavastathā /
analyzed: ye ye kule lupta piṇḍāḥ putra dāra vivarjitāḥ  kriyā lopa gatāḥ ye ca jātyandhāḥ paṅgavaḥ tathā
translated: Those who have no sons or wives in the family,🔽And those who have neglected rituals, those who are born blind or lame,

original: virūpā vā sagarbhā ye ye ca jātā kule mama //
analyzed: virūpāḥ vā sagarbhāḥ ye ye ca jātā kule mama
translated: And those who are deformed or pregnant, and those who are born in my family,

analyzed: teṣām piṇḍam mayā dattam akṣayyam upatiṣṭhatām
translated: To them I offer this ball of rice, may it be for their everlasting satisfaction.

analyzed: ye ye pitṛ vaṃśa jātāḥ syuḥ mātṛ vaṃśāḥ tathā eva ca
translated: Those who are born in the paternal lineage and those who are born in the maternal lineage,

original: kuladvaye dāsabhūtā ye cāsan sevakāśca vai //
analyzed: kula dvaye dāsa bhūtāḥ ye ca āsan sevakāḥ ca vai
translated: And those who were slaves in both families and those who were servants,

analyzed: mitrāṇi sakhyaḥ duṣṭāḥ ca ye ca kṛta apakāriṇaḥ
translated: Friends, companions, enemies, and those who have done me harm,

analyzed: teṣām uddharaṇa arthāya piṇḍam idam dadāmi aham bāndhavāḥ ye  pitṛ vaṃśa jātāḥ mātuḥ tathā ye bhavana ādi jātāḥ
translated: For their liberation, I offer this ball of rice.🔽Those who are related to me through the paternal lineage and those who are related to me through the maternal lineage,

analyzed: kula dvaye ye mama dāsa bhūtāḥ mṛtāḥ tathā eva amṛta sevakāḥ ca
translated: And those who were slaves in both families and those who have died and those who are serving the immortal ones,

original: mitrāṇi sakhyaḥ parasakhyaśca vṛkṣāḥ puṇyāśca duṣṭāśca
analyzed: mitrāṇi sakhyaḥ para sakhyaḥ ca vṛkṣāḥ puṇyāḥ ca duṣṭāḥ ca
translated: Friends, companions, and enemies, trees, meritorious ones, and wicked ones,

analyzed: kṛta upakārāḥ
translated: And those who have rendered help,

analyzed: ye mama dāsa bhṛtyāḥ teṣām abhimam piṇḍam aham dadāmi
translated: And those who were my slaves and servants in other births, to them I offer this ball of rice.

analyzed: sūryakuṇḍasya vāyavye dhanuḥ daṇḍa antare sthitaḥ
translated: In the northwest of the Sun's Pit, situated at a distance of one Dhanur-Danda,

analyzed: devaḥ gadādharaḥ tatra praṇipatya pradāpayet
translated: The god Gadadhara should be bowed to there and offerings should be made.

original: sākṣiṇaḥ santu ye bho devā brāhmaṇā vasavastathā /🔽mayā gayāṃ samāsādya pitṝṇāṃ niṣkṛtiḥ kṛtā // //
analyzed: sākṣiṇaḥ santu ye bho devāḥ brāhmaṇāḥ vasavaḥ tathā  mayā gayām samāsādya pitṝṇām niṣkṛtiḥ kṛtā
translated: May the gods, Brahmins, and Vasus be the witnesses, 🔽'Having reached Gaya, I have performed the rites for my ancestors.'

analyzed: āgataḥ uham gayām deva pitṛkārye gadādhara
translated: O God, I have come to Gaya for the rites for my ancestors, O Gadadhara.

analyzed: tvam eva sākṣī bhagavān anṛṇāḥ ham ṛṇa trayāt
translated: You alone are the witness, O Lord, I am free from the three debts.

original: pitṛpiṇḍasya madhye tu piṇḍaṃ dadyācca ṣoḍaśa /
analyzed: pitṛ piṇḍasya madhye tu piṇḍam dadyāt ca ṣoḍaśa
translated: In the middle of the ancestral ball, one should offer a ball of sixteen parts.

original: vartulaṃ kārayet piṇḍaṃ kṣīradhārāṃ ca pātayet // //
analyzed: vartulam kārayet piṇḍam kṣīra dhārām ca pātayet
translated: The ball should be made round and a stream of milk should be made to fall.

analyzed: gadādharasya vai vāme na ati dūreṇa śāṅkari
translated: O Shambhu, not far to the left of Gadadhara,

analyzed: tatra mātṛgayā devi dakṣiṇena sutīrthakam
translated: There is Matrigaya, O Goddess, to the south is an excellent holy place.

original: tathā gadādharaṃ devaṃ muktidaṃ keśavaṃ puruṣottamam /
analyzed: tathā gadādharam devam mukti dam keśavam puruṣottamam
translated: Similarly, the god Gadadhara, the giver of liberation, is Keshava, the best of men.

original: taṃ praṇamya prayatnena na bhūyo jāyate naraḥ // //
analyzed: tam praṇamya prayatnena na bhūyas jāyate naraḥ
translated: Having bowed to him with effort, a man is not born again.

analyzed: mauna ādityam mahātmānam kanaka arkam viśeṣataḥ
translated: Having seen the great-souled Sun of Silence, especially the golden sun,

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā maunena viprarṣiḥ pitṝṇām anugaḥ bhavet
translated: By seeing it silently, the Brahmin sage becomes a follower of the ancestors.

analyzed: brahmāṇam pūjayitvā ca brahma lokam avāpnuyāt
translated: By worshipping Brahma, one attains Brahma's world.

original: urvaśyā dakṣiṇe tīre yā śilā kanakaprabhā // //🔽sā vijñeyā ca gāyatrī pūjayedgandhacandanaiḥ /

translated: On the southern bank of the Urvaśī, the rock which has the lustre of gold,🔽That should be known as Gāyatrī. One should worship with fragrant sandal.

original: gāyatrīṃ prātarutthāya gāyatryā upāgamya samāhitaḥ prātarutthāya
analyzed: gāyatrīm prātar utthāya gāyatryāḥ upāgamya samāhitaḥ prātar utthāya
translated: Having risen in the morning, one should approach Gāyatrī with a concentrated mind.

analyzed: upāgamya tu nāmaśas
translated: Having approached, one should recite the names.

analyzed: sandhyām kṛtvā prayatnena sarva veda phalam labhet
translated: Having performed the sandhyā with effort, one would obtain the fruit of all the Vedas.

analyzed: sāvitrīn ca eva madhyāhne dṛṣṭvā yajña phalam labhet
translated: And having seen Sāvitrī at midday, one would obtain the fruit of a sacrifice.

analyzed: daśāśvamedhe dhanadaḥ devadevaḥ janārdanaḥ
translated: At Daśāśvamedha, Kubera, the god of gods, Janārdana,

analyzed: tatra piṇḍa pradānena tṛptiḥ bhavati śāśvatī
translated: By offering piṇḍas there, there is eternal satisfaction.

analyzed: gayāyām pitṛ rūpeṇa devadevaḥ janārdanaḥ
translated: At Gayā, Janārdana, the god of gods, in the form of the ancestors,

original: taṃ dṛṣṭvā puṇḍarīkākṣaṃ mucyate vai ṛṇatrayāt // //
analyzed: tam dṛṣṭvā puṇḍarīkākṣam mucyate vai ṛṇa trayāt
translated: Having seen that lotus-eyed one, one is freed from the three debts.

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā pitāmaham devam sarva pāpaiḥ pramucyate
translated: Having seen the god Brahmā, one is freed from all sins.

analyzed: makare vartamāne ca grahaṇe candra sūryayoḥ
translated: When the sun and moon are eclipsed in the sign of Capricorn,

analyzed: durlabhaḥ triṣu lokeṣu āgastye piṇḍapātanaḥ
translated: The offering of piṇḍas at Agastya is difficult to obtain in the three worlds.

original: ātmajo vā tathānyo vā gayākūpe'śvamedhike kṛtvā punarjanma na
analyzed: ātmajaḥ vā tathā anyaḥ vā gayākūpa iśvamedhike kṛtvā punarjanma na
translated: Having done so in the Gayākūpa or the Aśvamedhika, rebirth does not

analyzed: vidyate
translated: exist again.

original: yannāmnā pātayet piṇḍaṃ taṃ nayed brahma śāśvatam /
analyzed: yad nāmnā pātayet piṇḍam tam nayet brahma śāśvatam
translated: By whose name one offers the funeral cake, one would lead him to the eternal Brahman.

analyzed: tat brahma kalpitam sthānam viprāḥ brahma prakalpitāḥ
translated: That place is created by Brahman, and the Brahmins are created by Brahman.

original: pūjitaiḥ pūjitāḥ sarve pitṛbhiḥ saha devatāḥ /
analyzed: pūjitaiḥ pūjitāḥ sarve pitṛbhiḥ saha devatāḥ
translated: All the worshipped ones are worshipped along with the ancestors and the deities.

analyzed: tarpayet tu gayā viprān havya kavya vidhānataḥ
translated: One should offer libations to the Brahmins of Gayā according to the injunctions of Havya and Kavya.

analyzed: dānam na hi parityāgaḥ gayāyān tu vidhīyate
translated: In Gayā, giving is not considered as abandoning.

original: yaḥ karoti mahādānaṃ vṛṣotsargaṃ karoti yaḥ // //
analyzed: yaḥ karoti mahādānam vṛṣotsargam karoti yaḥ
translated: One who performs great giving, one who performs the rite of releasing a bull,

original: daśāśvamedhike tīrthe śattīrthāni sthitāni tatra suvrate muktide sa ca🔽mānavaḥ /
analyzed: daśāśvamedhike tīrthe śat tīrthāni sthitāni tatra suvrate mukti de sa ca  mānavaḥ
translated: at the Daśāśvamedhika Tīrtha, there are sixty-four holy places, O one of good vows, and that man gives liberation.

analyzed: catuḥṣaṣṭi dhanuḥ mānam kṣetram āgastyam īritam  /
translated: The field of Agastya is said to be four and fifty Dhanus in measure.

analyzed: pañcapañcāśatam tīrtham uktam tīrtham sumadhyame
translated: The holy place is said to be five and fifty, O slender-waisted one.

original: urvaśī ca tathā sūryaḥ kāmaḥ putraśca vāsavaḥ // //
analyzed: urvaśī ca tathā sūryaḥ kāmaḥ putraḥ ca vāsavaḥ
translated: Urvaśī, the Sun, Kāma, the son of Indra,

analyzed: āgastyaḥ ca aśvamedhaḥ ca tīrthasāraḥ gayāvilaḥ
translated: Agastya, Aśvamedha, the essence of holy places, and Gayāśiras,

analyzed: udbandhana mṛtāḥ ye ca gala pāśa mṛtāḥ ca ye
translated: Those who die by hanging and those who die by strangulation,

original: p / patiduṣṭā citrabhraṣṭā ca yā nārī kriyā teṣāṃ na vidyate /
analyzed: pati duṣṭā citra bhraṣṭā ca yā nārī kriyā teṣām na vidyate
translated: and that woman who is abandoned by her husband or who has lost her chastity, for them no religious rites are performed.

original: nāntyeṣṭirna ca dāhaśca nāśaucaṃ teṣu vidyate // //🔽āgastye ca gayāyāñca kriyāṃ kuryāt trirātrakam /
analyzed: na antyeṣṭiḥ na ca dāhaḥ ca na āśaucam teṣu vidyate  āgastye ca gayāyām ca kriyām kuryāt tri rātrakam
translated: There is no funeral ceremony, no cremation, and no impurity for them.🔽In the Agastya and Gayatri sacrifices, one should perform the rites for three nights.

analyzed: amāyām ca samārabhya kuryāt ca eva tri rātrakam
translated: And having begun on the new moon day, one should also perform for three nights.

original: anyatra ca kriyāṃ teṣāṃ yaḥ karoti sudurmatiḥ /
analyzed: anyatra ca kriyām teṣām yaḥ karoti su durmatiḥ
translated: And he who, being very wicked-minded, performs the rites for them elsewhere,

original: viphalā ca kriyā teṣāṃ careccāndrāyaṇaṃ vratam // //
analyzed: viphalā ca kriyā teṣām caret cāndrāyaṇam vratam
translated: their rites are fruitless, and he should observe the Chandrayana vow.

analyzed: tatas śuddhim avāpnoti anyathā pātakī bhavet
translated: Then he attains purity, otherwise he becomes a sinner.

original: anyatīrthe aśvatīrthe kṛtaṃ pāpaṃ gayāyāntu vinaśyati // //🔽gayāyāṃ yat kṛtaṃ pāpaṃ rāmakṣetre vinaśyati /

translated: The sin committed in other holy places and in the horse holy place is destroyed in Gayatri.🔽The sin committed in Gayatri is destroyed in Rama's holy place.

original: rāmakṣetre kṛtaṃ pāpaṃ maṇikūṭe vinaśyati // //🔽maṇikūṭe kṛtaṃ pāpaṃ nīlaśaile vinaśyati /
analyzed: rāma kṣetre kṛtam pāpam maṇi kūṭe vinaśyati  maṇikūṭe kṛtam pāpam nīlaśaile vinaśyati
translated: The sin committed in Rama's holy place is destroyed in Manikuta.🔽The sin committed in Manikuta is destroyed in Nilagiri.

analyzed: nīlaśaile kṛtam pāpam antar gehe vinaśyati  antar gehe kṛtam pāpam somatīrthe vinaśyati
translated: The sin committed in Nilagiri is destroyed in the inner house.🔽The sin committed in the inner house is destroyed in Soma tirtha.

analyzed: somatīrthe kṛtam pāpam maṃgalāyām vyapohati
translated: The sin committed in Soma tirtha is removed in Mangala.

original: maṅgalāyāṃ kṛtaṃ pāpam āgastye tu vinaśyati // //
analyzed: maṅgalāyām kṛtam pāpam āgastye tu vinaśyati  /
translated: The sin committed in Mangala is destroyed in Agastya.

original: āgastye yat kṛtaṃ pāpaṃ mandare tad vinaśyati /🔽mandare yat kṛtaṃ pāpaṃ vajralepe vinaśyati vajralepo bhaviṣyati // //
analyzed: āgastye yat kṛtam pāpam mandare tat vinaśyati  mandare yat kṛtam pāpam vajra lepe vinaśyati vajra lepaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: The sin committed in Agastya's month perishes on Mandara.🔽The sin committed on Mandara perishes on Vajra-lepa. Vajra-lepa will be...

analyzed: vajra lepāt ca yat pāpam aśva krānte vinaśyati
translated: The sin committed on Vajra-lepa perishes on Ashvakranta.

analyzed: aśvakrānte kṛtam pāpam urvaśyām tat vyapohati
translated: The sin committed on Ashvakranta is removed by Urvasi.

analyzed: māhātmya śravaṇena atha saṃhitā śravaṇena vai
translated: By listening to the greatness and by listening to the Samhita,

analyzed: dinam nayet maheśāni rātrau viṣṇu vicintanam
translated: one should spend the day, O Mahesani, and at night think of Vishnu.

original: p / kṛtvā vāsantu te'traiva naktaṃ mokṣyaṃ na vartayet /
analyzed: kṛtvā vāsantu tetra eva naktam mokṣyam na vartayet
translated: Having made the dwelling here itself, one should not dwell at night.

analyzed: tatas nya divase kālyā vipraḥ āgastye snānam ācaret  /
translated: Then on another day, the Brahmin should perform the bath of Kali in Agastya.

original: bhasmācalaṃ spṛśan dhārā sā vijñeyā sarasvatī /
analyzed: bhasma acalam spṛśan dhārā sā vijñeyā sarasvatī
translated: The stream touching the ash mountain should be known as Sarasvati.

analyzed: tatra svāhā maheśāni agniṣṭoma phalam labhet  /
translated: There, O Mahesani, one obtains the fruit of Agnistoma by touching Svaha.

analyzed: viṣṇoḥ vakṣaḥ sthite bhadre makaranda priye śubhe
translated: O auspicious one, O beloved of Makaranda, O auspicious one, residing on Vishnu's chest,

analyzed: janma janma arjitam pāpam hara me parameśvari
translated: remove the sin earned in birth after birth, O Supreme Goddess.

original: snāyādanena mantreṇa kārtike kārtikīṃ ca ca viśeṣataḥ /
analyzed: snāyāt anena mantreṇa kārtike kārtikīm ca ca viśeṣataḥ
translated: One should bathe with this mantra, especially on Kartik Full Moon in Kartika.

original: devasya pūrvabhāge tu vāpī tiṣṭhati śobhanā // //
analyzed: devasya pūrva bhāge tu vāpī tiṣṭhati śobhanā  /
translated: To the east of the Lord, there is an auspicious pond.

original: tasyāḥ svacchodakaṃ pītvā punarjanma na vidyate /
analyzed: tasyāḥ svaccha udakam pītvā punarjanma na vidyate
translated: Having drunk its clear water, there is no rebirth.

analyzed: āgneye bhasma śailasya dhanuḥ aṣṭa pramāṇataḥ
translated: In the southeast, at a distance of eight bows from the ash mountain,

analyzed: piśācamocanam nāma tīrtham paramakam śubhe
translated: there is a supreme and auspicious tirtha named Pishachamochana.

analyzed: piśācamocane tīrthe pūjayāmāsa śūlinam
translated: At the Pishachamochana tirtha, he worshipped the trident-bearer.

analyzed: idam devasya tat liṅgam kapardīśvaram uttamam
translated: This is the excellent Kapardeshvara Linga of the Lord.

analyzed: vāyavye bhasma kūṭasya dhanuḥ madana mānataḥ dhanuḥ vadana
translated: In the northwest, at a distance of a bow from the ash heap,

analyzed: kapālamocanam nāma tīrthebhyaḥ tīrtham uttamam
translated: the supreme tirtha among all tirthas is named Kapalamochana.

analyzed: pūjanīyam prayatnena stotavyam vividhaiḥ stavaiḥ
translated: It should be worshipped with effort and praised with various hymns.

original: kapālaṃ patitaṃ tasmin snāne ca mama sundari /
analyzed: kapālam patitam tasmin snāne ca mama sundari
translated: O beautiful one, my skull fell there during my bath.

analyzed: tasmin snātaḥ varārohe brahma hatyām vyapohati
translated: O beautiful lady, one who bathes there removes the sin of Brahmin-slaughter.

analyzed: kapāleśvaram īśānam asmin kapāleśvaraḥ īśāna asmin vyavasthitaḥ
translated: The lord of lords, Kapaleshvara, is established here.

analyzed: tīrthe vyavasthitam
translated: Established in this tirtha.

original: tasyottare dhanuḥ pañca kapilā nāma vai śive // //
analyzed: tasya uttare dhanuḥ pañca kapilāḥ nāma vai śive  /
translated: To its north, at a distance of five bows, O auspicious one, is the Kapila river.

original: p / tatra snātvā varārohe mucyate bhavabandhanāt /
analyzed: tatra snātvā varārohe mucyate bhava bandhanāt

original: navapīṭhasya yattīrthaṃ śṛṇu vai tasya devatāḥ // //
analyzed: nava pīṭhasya yat tīrtham śṛṇu vai tasya devatāḥ
translated: Listen to the deities of the holy place of the nine seats.

analyzed: vaśiṣṭha śāpāt ekatra gatvā tatra samāhitaḥ
translated: Having gone there with concentration, due to the curse of Vasiṣṭha,

original: ekatra tīrthaṃ kṛtvā ca ekatra caiva devatāḥ // //
analyzed: ekatra tīrtham kṛtvā ca ekatra ca eva devatāḥ
translated: Having made the holy place in one place and the deities in one place,

analyzed: snātvā ca vidhivat devi yātrā caitre viśiṣyate
translated: Having bathed according to the rules, O Goddess, the pilgrimage is especially recommended in Caitra.

analyzed: pūjayet parayā bhaktyā pratipīṭha phalam labhet
translated: One should worship with supreme devotion and obtain the fruit of each seat.

analyzed: tasya pīṭhasya āgneye yāma mātra antare sthitaḥ
translated: Situated at a distance of one yama from the southeast of that seat,

analyzed: kurukṣetram mahā kṣetram yatra brahmasaraḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: The great holy place of Kurukṣetra, where the Brahma lake is remembered,

analyzed: tatra snātvā ca vidhivat paśyet devapitāmaham
translated: Having bathed there according to the rules, one should see the god Brahmā.

analyzed: daśāśvamedha jam puṇyam prāpnuyāt na atra saṃśayaḥ  /
translated: One obtains the merit arising from ten horse sacrifices, there is no doubt about this.

analyzed: tasya āgneye pūrva bhāge yatra prācī sarasvatī
translated: In the east of its southeast, where the eastern Sarasvatī flows,

original: tasyāṃ ca vidhivat snātvā brahmahatyāṃ vyapohati // //
analyzed: tasyām ca vidhivat snātvā brahma hatyām vyapohati
translated: Having bathed there according to the rules, one removes the sin of killing a brahmin.

analyzed: udumbarī vat jātā ca yojanānām gatā matā
translated: Born like the Udumbara tree, it is considered to have gone a Yojana.

analyzed: udakāpsarā tu prathame dvitīyā paścimāpsarāḥ
translated: The first is the Udaka Apsara, the second is the Western Apsara.

original: vilā ca kavilā jātā tasmāt sā kavilā smṛtā /
analyzed: vilā ca kavilā jātā tasmāt sā kavilā smṛtā
translated: And Vila became Kavi, therefore she is remembered as Kavi.

analyzed: kavilāyām naraḥ snātvā makara sthe divākare
translated: A man having bathed in Kavi on the day when the Sun is in Capricorn,

analyzed: samprāpya sakalān kāmān śiva lokāya gacchati
translated: Having attained all desires, goes to the world of Shiva.

analyzed: muktaye sarva pāpānām brahmaṇā nirmitā purā
translated: For the liberation from all sins, formerly created by Brahma,

original: p / kavile nirmale snātvā trāhi māṃ bhavasāgarāt /
translated: Having bathed in the pure Kavi, protect me from the ocean of worldly existence.

original: anena snānaṃ kṛtvā tu dadyādarghyaṃ vibhūtaye // //
analyzed: anena snānam kṛtvā tu dadyāt arghyam vibhūtaye
translated: Having performed this bath, one should offer Arghya to Vibhuti,

analyzed: kuśa candana dūrvābhiḥ tila akṣata samanvitam
translated: Along with Kusha, sandalwood, Durva, sesame and unbroken rice.

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā kṣīram ca toyam ca tatas ṛghyam samudīritam
translated: Having seen milk and water, then Arghya is recommended.

analyzed: kañjanam śūnyasambhūtam vāguram vijayam tathā
translated: Kanjana, Shunyasaṃbhūta, Vāgura, Vijaya,

analyzed: mahāsenam vahnijāyām arghya mantraḥ ṣaṣ akṣaraḥ
translated: Mahāsena, and Vahnijāyā, the six-syllabled Arghya mantra.

original: caitre māsi sitāṣṭamyāṃ tarayāṃ snātvā divaṃ vrajet /
analyzed: caitre māsi sita aṣṭamyām tarayām snātvā divam vrajet
translated: On the eighth day of the bright fortnight in the month of Chaitra, having bathed in Tarayā, one would go to heaven.

original: pūrṇāyāṃ vā maheśāni śivasya sadanaṃ vrajet // //
analyzed: pūrṇāyām vā maheśāni śivasya sadanam vrajet  /
translated: O Maheśānī, on the full moon day, one would go to the abode of Shiva.

analyzed: kārtikam sakalam māsam yaḥ u vagāhet ca śāṅkari
translated: O Daughter of Shakra! One who bathes in the month of Kartika,

original: iha loke tvarogī syāt saṃprāpya cottamaṃ sukham // //
analyzed: iha loke tu arogī syāt saṃprāpya ca uttamam sukham
translated: In this world, he will be free from disease and attain supreme happiness.

analyzed: śeṣe brahmagṛham prāpya tatas mokṣam avāpnuyāt
translated: In the remaining part, reaching the abode of Brahma, he will then attain liberation.

original: kuśāvarte daivate ca samprāpte saṃgate kubjikāmukhe // //
analyzed: kuśa āvarte daivate ca samprāpte saṃgate kubjikā mukhe
translated: When the deity Kushavarta arrives and meets Kubjika's face,

analyzed: niṣphalā durlabhā eṣā kuśāvarte tu saphalā
translated: This is fruitless and difficult to obtain, but at Kushavarta, it becomes fruitful.

analyzed: mānase kubjidhārā ca prācīdhārā sarasvatī
translated: In Manasa, there is the stream of Kubja and the eastern stream of Sarasvati.

analyzed: tridhārā saṅgamam yatra tat kuśāvartam īritam
translated: Where these three streams meet, that is called Kushavarta.

original: tatra pūjā japo homaḥ kṛtaṃ bhavati dehinām // //
analyzed: tatra pūjā japaḥ homaḥ kṛtam bhavati dehinām
translated: There, worship, japa, and homa performed by embodied beings

analyzed: tat ananta phalam sarvam brahma mukti rata ātmanām
translated: Become fruitful for those devoted to liberation from Brahma.

original: dattaśrāddhaṃ tadā tatra kṛtaṃ bhavati cākṣayam // //
analyzed: datta śrāddham tadā tatra kṛtam bhavati ca akṣayam

original: dhanuṣāñca sahasreṇa tat kṣetraṃ paramaṃ mahat /
analyzed: dhanuṣām ca sahasreṇa tat kṣetram paramam mahat
translated: That great and supreme holy place extends for a thousand bows.

analyzed: ūrdhva bhāge tu yāma ardhe ekasya eva tu saṅgamam
translated: In the upper half of the southern direction, there is the confluence of only one.

original: dakṣiṇasrāviṇī dhārā sā tu kubji mahānadī /
analyzed: dakṣiṇa srāviṇī dhārā sā tu kubji mahā nadī
translated: That great river Kubja flows to the south.

analyzed: tasyām ca cāruvān snātvā rogī bhavati na anyathā
translated: Having bathed in it, one becomes free from disease, not otherwise.

original: p / uttarasya tu yā dhārā mānasaṃ nāmataḥ śrutam /
analyzed: uttarasya tu yā dhārā mānasam nāmataḥ śrutam
translated: The stream to the north is known by the name of Manas.

original: pūrvasyāñcaiva yā dhārā kīrtitā sā sarasvatī // //
analyzed: pūrvasyām ca eva yā dhārā kīrtitā sā sarasvatī
translated: And the stream to the east is called Sarasvati.

analyzed: tristhāne saṅgamam yatra prayāgam tat prakīrtitam
translated: Where the confluence is in the three places, that is declared to be Prayaga.

analyzed: uttare kṣetre aiśānye dhanuṣān ca pramāṇataḥ  /

analyzed: kubjisaṃjñam mahā tīrtham tatra snātvā divam vrajet
translated: There is a great tirtha called Kubji, bathing there one goes to heaven.

analyzed: kubji prāptam sutam dṛṣṭvā pitṛṇām anṛṇaḥ bhavet

analyzed: upaspṛśya tatra gatvā nārī snānī vā puruṣaḥ kvacid
translated: Having touched there and gone there, a woman or a man who has bathed somewhere,

analyzed: kubjikāyāḥ prasādena mucyate brahma hatyayā
translated: By the grace of Kubjika, is freed from the sin of killing a brahmin.

analyzed: tīre dhanuḥ śatam ca eva yāvat rāma hrada avadhi
translated: On the bank, up to a distance of one hundred bows, up to the lake of Rama,

analyzed: tāvat kṣetram bhadrakālyā gatvā sampūjya kālikām
translated: Up to that extent is the field of Bhadrakali. Having gone there and worshipped Kali,

translated: With milk pudding, fragrances etc., and with meat and offerings,

analyzed: kali dvāparayoḥ sandhau gupta kālī sarasvatī
translated: At the junction of Kali and Dvapara, Sarasvati is the hidden Kali.

analyzed: tasmāt tatra jale devīm kṣetre sampūjya pūjayet

analyzed: kubjikāyām tatas snātvā kālī kṣetram vrajet tu yaḥ sadā
translated: One who then bathes in Kubjika and goes to the holy place of Kali, always,

analyzed: spṛṣṭvā tu mānasam tatra mucyate bhava bandhanāt

analyzed: dhanānām kāñcanam yadvat pavitrāṇām ca dakṣiṇā
translated: As gold is among riches, and dakshina among holy things,

analyzed: aśvamedhaḥ tu yajñeṣu yathā śreṣṭhaḥ prakīrtitaḥ

analyzed: tathā samasta tīrthānām kujvitīrthaṃmukham varam
translated: so Kubjita Tīrtha is the best of all holy places.

analyzed: devarṣīṇām yathā śreṣṭhaḥ nāradaḥ mama suvrate
translated: O my virtuous one, just as Nārada is the best of the celestial sages,

analyzed: tathā samasta tīrthānām kubjitīrtha mukham varam
translated: so Kubjita Tīrtha is the best of all holy places.

analyzed: uttare kālikṣetrasya devadevaḥ janārdanaḥ  /

in the form of a Liṅga, in a hidden state, will disappear in the Kali Yuga.

translated: On its bank, one should drink milk with the Nārāyaṇa Mantra and the Sāman Mantra, with devotion and effort.

analyzed: daśa janma kṛtāt pāpāt tad kṣaṇāt eva mucyate
translated: One is instantly freed from the sins committed in ten births.

translated: Situated just a krośa (3 miles) to the west of Kuśāvarta,

analyzed: caturdaśyām tathā aṣṭamyām ekādaśyām ca parvaṇi

analyzed: kavilāyām tatas snātvā yaḥ paśyati kapardinam

translated: and on the south of the Kalpa tree, it is one Krośa (3 Kms.) in extent.

analyzed: daśāśvamedhakam nāma kṣetram parama durlabham
translated: The holy place named Daśāśvamedha is very difficult to obtain.

analyzed: atra yat dīyate dānam kurukṣetra adhikam phalam
translated: Whatever gift is given here, its fruit is more than that of Kurukṣetra.

original: atra yaḥ pratigṛhṇāti akṣayaṃ narakaṃ vrajet /
analyzed: atra yaḥ pratigṛhṇāti akṣayam narakam vrajet
translated: One who accepts a gift here would go to hell eternally.

analyzed: prayāge kubjitīrthe vā vagāhya na punar bhavet

analyzed: aśvakrānte picchilāyām muṇḍane uttamam phalam
translated: At Aśvakrānta, Piścilā, and Muṇḍanā, the fruit is excellent.

analyzed: anargha acala sañjātā yā khyātā vaguḍā nadī
translated: The river Vaguḍā, which originates from the priceless mountain,

analyzed: bhādra śukla caturdaśyām tasyām snātvā divam vrajet
translated: having bathed in it on the fourteenth day of the bright fortnight of Bhādrapada, one goes to heaven.

analyzed: yā piñjācala saṃyātā toyadā nāmataḥ smṛtā
translated: The river known as Toyadā, which originates from Piñjācala,

analyzed: tatra snātvā mahāmāghyām punāti āsaptamam kulam
translated: having bathed there on the great full moon day of Māgha, one purifies the family up to seven generations.

analyzed: dvārakeśvara liṅgam ca dakṣiṇe parameśvari
translated: O Supreme Goddess, the Liṅga named Dvārakīśvara is on the south,

translated: The Brahmi, Varahi, and Lakshmi forms of the goddess were also present, with Lakshmi being the youngest.

analyzed: snātvā sarasvatī tīrthe devadevam umāpatim
translated: Having bathed in the tirtha of Saraswati, and worshipped the god of gods, the lord of Uma,

analyzed: sampūjya ca trayodaśyām mucyate bhava bandhanāt
translated: and having worshipped on the thirteenth day, one is freed from the bondage of worldly existence.

analyzed: atra svarṇa nadī puṇyā vāyukoṇe tu śāṅkari
translated: Here, O Shambhavi, in the northwest direction, is the sacred river Svarnna.

original: bhādre māsi tṛtīyāyāṃ na śoko jāyate kvacit // //
analyzed: bhādre māsi tṛtīyāyām na śokaḥ jāyate kvacid
translated: On the third day of the month of Bhadra, grief never arises anywhere.
Having bathed in the water of Vaja, one is freed from terrible sins.

analyzed: viṣṇudhārā jale snātvā nāka pṛṣṭhe svarga loke pramodate
translated: Having bathed in the water of Vishnu's stream, one rejoices in the heavenly world of heaven.

analyzed: guru dhārā jale snātvā aśvamedhan ca vindati
translated: Having bathed in the water of Guru's stream, one obtains a horse sacrifice.

analyzed: kālidhārā jale snātvā sarvān kāmān avāpnuyāt
translated: Having bathed in the water of Kali's stream, one obtains all desires.

analyzed: tṛṇaśailasya pāścātye dhanuḥ pañca antare sthitaḥ
translated: To the west of Trinashala, situated within five dhanus,

analyzed: kṣetram śṛṅgāṭakam nāma kardinam ha varjayet
translated: is the sacred place named Shringataka. One should avoid the direction of Varuna.

analyzed: salilāyām naraḥ snātvā maṅgalāyām maheśvari
translated: O Mahesvari, a man having bathed in the auspicious river Salila,

analyzed: śṛṅgāṭakam samāruhya pūjayet ca kapardinam
translated: and having climbed Shringataka, should worship Kapardin (Shiva).

analyzed: sa dīpta kāyaḥ śuddha ātmā prāpya kāmān iha atulān
translated: He, with a radiant body and pure soul, having obtained incomparable desires here,

analyzed: ante bharga gṛham yāti tatas mokṣam avāpnuyāt
translated: In the end, he goes to the abode of Bharga (the Sun) and then attains liberation.

analyzed: tasya paścima bhāge tu śveta saṅketa kīrtitā
translated: To the west of that, known as Shveta-sanket,

analyzed: kālanarā nadī khyātā sarva pāpa pramocinī
translated: The river known as Kala-nara, which liberates from all sins.

original: māghe māsi site pakṣe dvādaśyāṃ śuklapakṣake /
analyzed: māghe māsi site pakṣe dvādaśyām śukla pakṣake

analyzed: sa yāti viṣṇu sadanam śarīreṇa virājitaḥ
translated: He goes to Vishnu's abode, shining with his body.

analyzed: namaḥ te sarvatobhadre svarga mokṣa pradāyini
translated: Salutations to you, O auspicious one in every way, O giver of heaven and liberation!

analyzed: viṣṇu kūṭa samudbhūte pāpa hara namaḥ astu te  /
translated: O river arising from Vishnu's peak, O remover of sins, salutations to you!

original: ityanena hi mantreṇa snānaṃ kuryāt prapūjayet /
analyzed: iti anena hi mantreṇa snānam kuryāt prapūjayet
translated: One should bathe and worship with this mantra.

analyzed: vāntam daśa akṣara yutam raśmi bindu vibhūṣitam
translated: The vomit, endowed with the ten-syllable mantra, adorned with a ray and a dot,

analyzed: śūnyam puṇyam candra anvitam kṛtvā hṛdayam ca śikhān tathā
translated: Having made the void, the auspicious, and the moon, the heart and the topknot likewise,

analyzed: pūjana īrghya pradāne ca yaḥ japet vijita indriyaḥ
translated: One who conquers the senses and chants while worshipping and offering arghya,

original: p / patantī ca suparṇā ca māgadhī yamunā parā palanāparā /
analyzed: patantī ca suparṇā ca māgadhī yamunā parā palanā aparā
translated: The falling, the Suparna, the Magadha, the supreme Yamuna, the supreme Palana,

analyzed: kallolā ca śikhaṇḍī śikhinī ca śatarudrā ghṛtārcikā
translated: The waves, the peacock, the peahen, the hundred Rudras, the ghee-worshipping one.

analyzed: aṣṭadhārā tu yatra eva puṇya dhārā sarit varā
translated: Where there are eight streams, the best of holy rivers,

analyzed: catuḥ snātvā caturdaśyām graha doṣaiḥ na lipyate
translated: Having bathed at the four (places) on the fourteenth day, one is not tainted by the faults of the planets.
